title: Job Openings at Lafarge Africa Plc
content:
Lafarge Africa Plc is a member of the LafargeHolcim Group – the biggest building and concrete solutions company in the world. It is a publicly quoted company on the Nigerian Stock Exchange (NSE) and serves Nigeria with a wide range of building and construction solutions designed to meet housing and construction needs from small projects like individual home buildings to major construction and infrastructure projects.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Mechanical Planner

Requisition ID: 13859
Job Location: Ewekoro, Ogun
Job type: Full-time

About the Job
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Improve the efficiency and productivity of own personnel and third party services through a good planning, follow up and optimization of all preventive/corrective maintenance tasks to reach the targets of equipment availability / reliability at the lowest sustainable maintenance cost, in collaboration with all involved departments or sub-departments, following the maintenance guide lines defined by the company.


What you'll be doing 


	The Mechanical Planner is responsible to prepare all planned maintenance that have to be carried out by the Mechanical Execution team, service companies or contractors.


Responsibilties
In that role, the Mechanical Planner will work closely with the inspectors and the execution team on the following tasks and responsibilities in order to reinforce the day-to-day job preparation & planning:


	Planning and scheduling of all preventive maintenance routines in SAP/DMS together with the specific execution responsible.
	Generation and optimization of the 48/96 weeks workload balancing sheet by department/specialty/technic targeting a good balance during the days of the year.
	Generates the weekly and 13 weeks planning.
	Prioritizes the notifications coming from condition monitoring or others and generates corrective work orders in agreement with the requester
	Leads the preparation and consolidation of the shutdown planning (personal, third parties services, materials, spare parts, equipment, tools, time, critical path) with coordination meetings using MAC guidelines and tools.
	Generates purchase orders as well as third party services contracts for mayor shutdown, assure that spares and services will be delivered on time.
	Control of expenses during planning as well during the execution vs budget and control the inventory level vs guide value
	Assure that special and repetitive jobs come with a standard work order. Lead the weekly KPI revision meeting as well as the work planning confirmation for the next week
	Takes care of his own development needs and train maintenance people on planning requirements
	Assure that all work orders have the required H&S information, and that all legal requirements (safety, environmental, maintenance) are in the yearly preventive maintenance plan and are executed.
	Monitor the realization of the plans.
	Follow-up tasks defined in mayor shut-downs in a daily frequency.
	Leads After Action Review for shutdown or mayor repairs
	The Mechanical Planner will be utilized to supervise some jobs and contractors during annual plant
	The list is not exhaustive as planners may be required to perform other functions as may be assigned by the manager.


What we are looking for 


	Mechanical Engineering graduate
	3-5 years of experience in Mechanical Engineering, including rotating machines, equipment maintenance, condition monitoring, in cement manufacturing company, refinery, power or heavy process plan
	Knowledge of gearboxes, transmissions, hydraulic, pneumatic, welding techniques, lubrication, and mechanical non-destructive testing
	Adequate Knowledge related to equipment function & maintenance (Crusher, Stacker, Reclaimer, Raw mill, Belt Conveyors & Aux. Equipments)
	Good knowledge of Machinery condition Monitoring technologies and maintenance philosophies.
	Ability to trouble shoots the problem and proposed corrective actions.
	Excellent knowledge of vibration analysis, oil analysis, wear measurement, thermography, liquid penetrant, ultrasonic, magnetic particle, radiography, etc
	Good knowledge of RCA methodology and facilitating skills
	CMRP certification will be an added advantage.


Who you'll be working with:
List of direct reports:


	None 


Key Interfaces, stakeholders and relatinships:


	Inspector
	Lubrication Foreman
	Inventory
	Area Manager
	Shift Leader
	Workshop
	External contractors and suppliers
	Procurement,
	Finance.


Click here to apply online

 

2.) Drill Rig Operator

Requisition ID: 14162
Job Location: Mfamosing, Cross River
Job type: Full-time

About the Job 


	The role holder is primarily responsible for operating a drilling machine to create holes in rock at the quarry or for surface mining operations. 
	He/she would also be involved in setting up and maintaining the drilling equipment, ensuring safe working practices and potentially supervising junior operators. 
	Monitor and keep an accurate record of drill accessories consumption to avoid wastage of bits.


Responsibilities


	Operate the drilling machine to create blasting holes in rock, following safety protocols and operational procedures.
	Conduct regular inspections and maintenance on the drilling equipment to ensure optimal performance and minimise downtime.
	Ensure a safe working environment by implementing safety measures, adhering to safety regulations, and reporting any unsafe conditions
	Collaborate with mining engineers and geologists to assess drilling sites and plan drilling operations in line with production demand.
	Maintain accurate records of drilling operations, including depth, pressure, and production rates.
	Monitor and keep a very accurate record of drilling accessories consumption, ascertain and eschew wastages of drill bits.
	Maybe responsible for supervising junior operators and support staff, providing training and guidance on drilling techniques and safety practices.


Who you'll be working with:


	Human dimension: Quarry Engineer.
	Organisational dimension: The incumbent interacts regularly with all categories of Staff in the Plant and offers professional advice on best practice to operate mobile equipment.
	He/she also interacts regularly with the plant operators on best operating practices.


Requirements


	Minimum OND/ND Certificate 
	Minimum of 3 years of post-qualification experience in machine main systems.
	Fully understand the machine operation parameters (feed pressure, percussion pressure, flushing air pressure and temperature)
	Good knowledge of safety regulations and rules applicable in an industrial area
	Effectively coordinate the activities of the Mobile Plant department
	Ability to prioritise with excellent time management skills
	Good attention to detail and communication skills.


Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Security Operative

Requisition ID: 10385
Job Location: Mfamosing, Cross River
Job type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Security Operative (SO) is responsible for keeping Lafarge Africa and suppliers’ staff, visitors, and similar safe & secure.
	Based on shift work rotation the SO will be in the plant between eight and twelve hours, also on weekends, and supervise all security related activities while in parallel supervise and support all company transport activities.


What you'll be doing


	Responsible for the protection of the company’s PEARL (People, Environment, Assets, Reputation & Legal Exposure) in the South-East Region under the direction of the Security Manager South-East.
	Support the supervision of the Private Security Provider, ensuring they fulfil their contractual obligations. Conduct supervisory checks on the 3rd party security provider and the services provided such as random checks at guard locations in Mfamosing Plant (MFA) and Calabar, joining vehicular patrols and ensuring all standards agreed are being fulfilled. To be conducted utilising various online tools that are available.
	Ensure Lafarge Health & Safety standards are adhered to.
	Supervise and direct the armed security incident response force.
	Supervise and direct security assets during crises periods and/or in case of direct assaults on company staff and/or assets.
	Provide reliable and concise incident data and write accurate reports via the various company online tools.
	Interact with the local PSF (Public Security Forces) in cases of (armed) attacks, intrusions, trespassing, fraud and theft.
	Safeguard that all Security & Resilience Policies of the company are adhered to.
	Act as a communicator between the Plant Management and Security Department when the Senior Security Operatives is not present.
	Work in shifts ensuring there is a 24/7 security supervision function on duty.
	Support with investigations and detailed report writing. Validate reporting independent of the Private Security Provider’s report.
	 Conduct independent assessments and identify gaps in baseline physical security and notify/ advise both the Security Manager and Senior Security Operative.
	Gather local intelligence on all aspects and issues to support and protect the business.
	Create and maintain intelligence networks.
	Reporting of incidents on the Group Security SINT platform.
	Monitoring and supervision of CCTV operators, video evidence assessment and ongoing projects.


What we are looking for


	OND minimum requirement 
	A minimum of 4 years of experience in a security supervisory position
	Security incident supervisory experience (incl. following up on complex incidents such as shootings, armed attacks, theft, and similar)
	Experience of supervising teams and resources
	Capability to drive Lafarge security standards in all business activities.
	Be Microsoft Office proficient
	Ability to produce different kind of vetted and accurate incident reports.


Who you'll be working with:


	Senior Security Operative
	Contractors 
	All levels of staff.

title: Manager, Project Job at Stanbic IBTC Bank
content:
Stanbic IBTC Bank is a leading African banking group focused on emerging markets globally. It has been a mainstay of South Africa's financial system for 150 years, and now spans 16 countries across the African continent.

Standard Bank is a firm believer in technical innovation, to help us guarantee exceptional client service and leading edge financial solutions. Our growing global success reflects our commitment to the latest solutions, the best people, and a uniquely flexible and vibrant working culture. To help us drive our success into the future, we are looking for resourceful individuals to join our dedicated team at our offices.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Manager, Project
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full-time

Job Description


	To manage the delivery of projects through the application of best practice project management skills, tools and techniques, whilst engaging with and leading cross-functional teams to deliver scalable business solutions within the required parameters in terms of scope, cost and quality.


Requirements


	First degree in IT and Computer Sciences or related discipline
	Minimum of 4 years of experience in Business Operations and Information Technology related roles is an additional requirement.
	Project Management Certification (PMP, PRINCE2, SAFE Agile etc.) will be an added advantage.


Behavioural Competencies:


	Following Procedures
	Making Decisions
	Managing Tasks
	Meeting Timescales
	Producing Output
	Team Working
	Upholding Standards.


Technical Competencies:


	Project Accounting
	Change Management
	Project Management
	Project Reporting.

title: Branch Manager Job at 1k shop
content:
1k shop is one of the best super market in Benin city around airport road.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Branch Manager

Job Location: Benin / Airport road, Edo
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Plan and direct day to day operational activities of the branch.
	Liaise with General Manager to develop business strategies that will attract new customers, expand store traffic, and enhance profitability towards achieving set target.
	Supervise the activities of the Floor Manager and all heads of department, also, communicate with cleaning and security agents on the performance of their employees.
	Handling the process for product swap and customer cash refunds.
	Ensure all employees in the branch deliver excellent customer service at all times to enhance customer satisfaction.
	Ensure all employees are properly dresses and presentable at all times depicting morals and the organizational standard.
	Monitor sales trends of different products and motivate the team to drive sales to meet sales objectives
	Foster positive environment and ensure customer satisfaction by responding to customer complaints and resolving customers concerns in a professional manner
	Liaise with government regulatory agencies and ensure timely compliance.
	Monitor inventory levels and ensure that items ordered are supplied on time to avoid stock-out on the shop floor.
	Communicate any new policies and relevant information to all employee in the branch, giving correction and advice, and also receiving feedbacks and questions concerning their challenges as it relates to their job and any other relevant issues.
	Review duty roster to ensure adequate manning of every section and department
	Monitor staff attendance and report lateness and absenteeis
	Oversee the process of product procurement, Inventory process, product storage, proper product display and sales of product.
	Relate the outcome of such meetings to Management including suggestion/recommendation.
	Issue queries to employee who violate the company’s policy and forward the query issued and response received with your recommendation to the Human Resource Manager through the GM.
	Control losses that arise from damaged products, product stock out and expired products.
	Keep abreast with changes in government policies and its effect on the business and inform Management.
	Other responsibilities as may be assigned from time to time.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor’s Degree with 3 - 5 years of work experience.


Salary
N100,000 - N120,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: staffmanager@yehgs.co.uk using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: For more enquiries, call:+234 812 920 7496.
